title: Axway Delivers Fast, Easy Operational Intelligence with New Analytics for Industries Initiative
text:
Submitted by admin on 10/20/2015 @ 11:00 PM   Axway 
PHOENIX -- (BUSINESS WIRE) -- Organizations today are making significant investments to gain operational intelligence from the multitude of business interactions generated through social, mobile, cloud, and IoT (Internet of Things) technologies. The resulting explosion of data flows is also swamping their operations teams and slowing productivity. To address this challenge, Axway (Paris:AXW) (Euronext : AXW.PA), a market leader in governing the flow of data, today announced at its annual customer event, Axway Connections, a new initiative to deliver Analytics for Industries , a combination of analytics powered by Axway Decision Insight and expert best practices, in order to provide packaged dashboards tailored for specific industry processes. With this initiative, it is faster and easier for operations teams to make data-driven decisions to help optimize service levels, improve the customer experience, and increase revenue growth. 
The Analytics for Industries offering enables organizations across various industry sectors to transform their traditional business operations into new digital services by turning massive amounts of data into real-time insight. With this solution, organizations can deploy enhanced shipping and logistics tracking, payments and securities processing, and pharmaceuticals monitoring, according to their present capabilities and future needs. 
Analytics for Industries provides unique solutions for operation-focused teams across various industries, including: 
Retail, Logistics, and Manufacturing – Provides end-to-end visibility to supply chain managers, enabling them to proactively identify and resolve processing issues such as stuck orders and delivery deadlines and reduce unnecessary same-day and next-day business shipments. 
Payments and Securities Processing – Enables the automatic identification of unusual processing issues such as higher-than-expected volume of payments and failing straight-through processing (STP) routes. This also allows organizations to predict and reduce the risks of missing cut-offs by delivering actionable intelligence to payment and operations staff. 
Pharmaceuticals Monitoring – Improves compliance by helping organizations automatically learn customer profiles and order behaviors and identify suspicious orders or historical patterns before they are fulfilled or cancelled. 
“The growing volume and velocity of event data is driving companies to deploy broader monitoring, alerting and interactive decision-making solutions to improve their operations,” said Gartner analysts W. Roy Schulte and Ehtisham Zaida, in the recent report, “Market Guide for Operational Intelligence Platforms.” 1 
“As digital transformation takes hold in every industry, enterprises are discovering new revenue and business opportunities. As a result, engagement with an expanding ecosystem of partners and consumers through APIs, mobile devices, and the Internet of Things is spawning new digital business models,” said Jeanine Banks, executive vice president, global products and solutions, Axway. “The solution and expertise delivered with our Analytics for Industries initiative will take what was once an overwhelming amount of data and transform it into meaningful, real-time, consumable information to help our customers drive their businesses forward.” 
Gartner cites Axway as a representative vendor in its Market Guide for Operational Intelligence Platforms. 
¹Gartner Inc., Market Guide for Operational Intelligence Platforms, W. Roy Schulte, Ehtisham Azidi, 28 May 2015
